intro: Wentsaiboea, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hair, aiding in water retention. Wentsaiboea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
